title: Security hardening recommendations
content:
This topic provides the recommended steps for security hardening of OO Workflow Designer.

  1. Install OO Workflow Designer.
  2. (Optional) Configure OO Workflow Designer for FIPS 140-2 Compliance.
  3. Configure the OO Workflow Designer server certificate for TLS encryption and client certificate for strong authentication (mutual), which can be done during installation.
  4. Harden the OO Workflow Designer server by removing the HTTP port and replacing the passwords of the KeyStore and TrustStore with strong passwords.
  5. Remove the RC4 cipher from the SSL-supported ciphers.
  6. Harden/secure the operating system and database.
  7. In the Windows and SQL server environment, configure OO Workflow Designer to work with Windows authentication.

Default security settings

In many cases, it is recommended to modify the default security settings that are provided out-of-the-box.

  • Authentication – OO Workflow Designer uses IDM service for authentication.
  • TLS Encryption – By default, OO Workflow Designer supports TLS protocol 1.3.
  • TLS Server Certificate – By default, the user is asked to provide a CA certificate during the installation of the OO Workflow Designer server.
  • KeyStore, TrustStore, and Server Certificate Passwords – By default, Java passwords are provided for the keyStore, trustStore, and Server Certificate. It is recommended to replace these with encrypted passwords.
